meanings.definition: The quality or state of being phytotoxic.
meanings.sent1: The phytotoxicity of the chemical caused the plants to wither and die.
meanings.sent2: Farmers must be cautious of the phytotoxicity of pesticides to protect their crops.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous garden gnome sprinkled phytotoxicity powder on the flowers, turning them purple.
meanings.sent4: The phytotoxicity of the herbicide was like a silent assassin, slowly killing off the vegetation.
meanings.sent5: The phytotoxicity of the weed killer was so potent that even the hardiest plants couldn't survive.

meanings.definition: The ability of a substance to cause harm to plants.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the phytotoxicity of different chemicals to understand their impact on plant life.
meanings.sent2: Excessive phytotoxicity in the soil can lead to devastating effects on the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The gardeners joked that the unruly weeds had a secret weapon - their phytotoxicity.
meanings.sent4: The phytotoxicity of the invasive species spread like wildfire, wiping out native vegetation.
meanings.sent5: The farmer witnessed the phytotoxicity of the new fertilizer firsthand as his crops wilted under its influence.
